I played through the entire game in full co-op with a group of friends, and for an older title, the graphics hold up surprisingly well. The map is massive, stunning, and incredibly detailed. The story is top-notch, with a captivating plot that kept us engaged. The gunplay feels smooth and satisfying, but what really stood out to me were the AI enemies. They’re smart, realistic, and often sneak up behind you when you least expect it, adding a thrilling challenge. The attention to detail and realism in the them is truly impressive and greatly enhances the overall experience.

Definitely worth picking up on sale!

186010672.review:
Tom Clancy's Ghost Recon® Wildlands ist ein herausragendes Beispiel für ein Open-World-Actionspiel, das Freiheit, Teamarbeit und strategisches Denken auf höchstem Niveau kombiniert. Von der ersten Minute an ist es klar, dass das Spiel eine realistische, fesselnde Erfahrung bietet, die sowohl Einzelspieler als auch Koop-Fans begeistert.

Die offene Welt von Wildlands ist riesig und abwechslungsreich, mit verschiedenen Regionen, die jeweils ihre eigenen Herausforderungen, Gegner und Geheimnisse bieten. Ob in den dichten Wäldern, den steilen Gebirgen oder den trockenen Wüsten – jede Landschaft ist nicht nur optisch beeindruckend, sondern auch in den Missionsdesigns hervorragend integriert. Die Welt ist lebendig und fühlt sich authentisch an, was das Eintauchen in die Geschichte des Drogenkartells und des Widerstands unglaublich intensiv macht.

Das Gameplay von Wildlands ist eine meisterhafte Mischung aus taktischem Vorgehen, offenen Feuergefechten und einer unglaublichen Freiheit, wie du deine Missionen angehst. Die Möglichkeit, mit Freunden in einem Team aus bis zu vier Spielern zu spielen, bringt das Spiel auf ein neues Level. Kooperative Taktiken wie das gleichzeitige Ausschalten von Gegnern oder das Überwinden von Feinden ohne Alarm auszulösen, sind nur einige der Highlights, die das Spiel zu einem großartigen Erlebnis für Fans von Teamarbeit und strategischem Vorgehen machen.

Besonders gut gefällt mir die Vielzahl von Fahrzeugen und Waffen, die man im Spiel verwenden kann. Egal, ob man sich in einem Jeep durch das Gelände bewegt, einen Helikopter fliegt oder ein gut platziertes Scharfschützengewehr nutzt – die Vielfalt an Optionen sorgt für jede Menge Abwechslung und lässt dir viel Raum, deine eigenen Taktiken zu entwickeln.

Die KI der Gegner ist clever und stellt dich vor echte Herausforderungen. Sie reagieren auf deine Aktionen und stellen sicher, dass keine Mission zu einfach wird. Gleichzeitig kannst du deine Ghosts mit einer breiten Palette an Fähigkeiten und Ausrüstungen ausstatten, was die Anpassung an deinen Spielstil ermöglicht.

Kurz gesagt: Tom Clancy's Ghost Recon® Wildlands ist ein episches Open-World-Abenteuer, das auf Teamarbeit, strategischer Planung und unzähligen Möglichkeiten setzt, um jede Mission auf deine Weise zu lösen. Es ist ein Muss für alle, die realistische, taktische Shooter lieben, die sowohl im Einzelspieler als auch im Koop-Modus fesseln. Wenn du auf Action, Freiheit und taktische Präzision stehst, wirst du hier nicht enttäuscht!

186002456.review:
Tom Clancy's Ghost Recon: Wildlands — це військовий шутер у відкритому світі, що дозволяє гравцям виконувати місії як наодинці, так і в кооперативному режимі до чотирьох гравців. Дія гри розгортається в Болівії, яка перетворилася на нарко-державу під владою картелю "Санта-Бланка". Гравці беруть на себе роль елітного загону "Привидів", які мають зруйнувати вплив картелю та відновити порядок у країні.

Геймплей

Гра пропонує повну свободу дій у виконанні місій. Ви можете використовувати тактичний підхід, атакувати відкрито або діяти приховано. Світ гри динамічний, і ваші дії впливають на перебіг подій. Гравці можуть досліджувати гори, джунглі, пустелі та солончаки, використовуючи понад 60 видів транспорту, включаючи автомобілі, мотоцикли, човни та вертольоти.

Кооператив та мультиплеєр

Кооперативний режим дозволяє скоординувати дії з друзями, розподіляючи ролі у команді. Гравці можуть створювати власні стратегії, використовуючи зброю, дрони та інше спорядження. Мультиплеєрний режим "Ghost War" додає PvP-баталії у 4v4 форматі, де потрібно застосовувати тактику та співпрацю.

Кастомізація

Гравцям доступна повна кастомізація персонажів, зброї та спорядження. Ви можете створити унікальний стиль для свого "Привида", адаптуючи його під власний стиль гри.

Різноманітність світу

Болівія у грі поділена на різні регіони з унікальними ландшафтами, місіями та ворогами. Погода і час доби динамічні, що додає реалістичності та впливає на геймплей.

Висновок

Ghost Recon: Wildlands вражає масштабністю відкритого світу та свободою дій. Вона підійде як для любителів тактичних шутерів, так і для тих, хто цінує кооперативну гру. Завдяки можливості кастомізації та великій кількості контенту, гра залишається цікавою навіть після десятків годин геймплею.

this game is great, really fun with a friend or more than one friend. its really fun, for the first like 10-15 hours. and then it turns into a complete chore in terms of what youre tasked with doing. if you do nothing but the MSQ and dont drift off into random stuff like getting resources for leveling up or side content then youll realize that all of the story objectives are all the same. it ranges from:
go save this guy and extract him.
go kill this guy
go kidnap this guy and bring him to us to interrogate
destroy these drugs
steal this car
hack a computer and defend area while hacking
stealth mission
and its just all of those things cycled through over and over and over and over again for like 30-60 hours. around 30 if you bumrush the story. which theres two endings which one is to just beat the game and one is to 100% every single region of the game and that one is the "GOOD" ending. but the bad one is actually a much MUCH more satisfying ending anyways so who the fxck would go for the 100%????
also you can beat the game without even getting resources to level up. i played like 80% of the game with the stats and skill points spent of a level 10 character when i was level 40 or something. and if you do the side stuff to get those resources you'll quickly realize that..
drum roll please..
.
.
.
all of the side content is just EXACTLY what you do in the main game! yippeee yay! awesome! cool!
the game is so repetitive. BUT. THE PROS. the pros are the game doesnt have bullet spongey enemies and dying is a risk no matter what skill points youve put in or anything. fxck with the wrong guys and youll get hit, and sometimes overwhelmed quickly. but while that gameplay feels good, and can be super tactical and satisfying to do an entire mission, killing everyone and NO ONE finds you can feel AMAZING. it gets boring FAST. and if you start to rush through the story with the want to just see the ending, to see the credits, to feel OKAY DELETING it off your HDD/SSD like me, then you will resort to just running into every base, shooting everyone you see, and calling it a day.
i dont recommend this game unless you like repetitive or if you wanna watch tv while u zone out to this game lol. get it when its like $10. otherwise, pass.

I really want to like it and in the beginning I did. The progression though suffers greatly in the game. Most of the guns don't feel like they really pack the punch they need to take out most enemies and you have to use way too much ammo for sub machine guns so you are constantly reloading. 

Okay, the real thing though that makes me keep taking breaks from frustration in this game is that extreme difficulty isn't really balanced and the last missions feel rushed and not thought out for enemy placement. There is no way you can run and gun, or you can go stealth. No matter what you do in later missions enemies are already alerted from how its coded. When one enemy sees you THEY ALL SEE YOU and its really immersion breaking for me. One of the special ops missions you have to diffuse a bomb and basically you can't really have any set up because it kills civilians and people come from all ends so there is no cover when you have to "defend" your comrade. Really needs some work on balancing, but we will never get it for how old the game is now. Unfortunate.

 This game has a lot of potential but after having played through the game I have to give it a 5/10. Worth on sale but not full cost. Most of the hours is it sitting open while I was working or doing hw and then would do stuff during breaks.

Yeah, it's an Ubisoft game, so there's gonna be some stupid micro transactions and their usual jank, but GRW is one of the best open world environments I've seen in a game.  Driving and vehicles are kinda wonky, and so is climbing and descending, physics aren't really all that great either, but the sheer amount of freedom you have in this game coupled with how well the stealth action is done, make for a truly unique experience.

Unfortunately, this game is not optimized very well and even good setups can still suffer huge FPS drops and stuttering. Using the Lossless Scaling app with this game can save you a ton of time and frustration.  An extra $7 and a few minutes of tinkering that will double your FPS, as opposed to going through the litany of GFX settings in game, spending hours trying to fine tune your experience to get minimal returns is well worth it.

Story: 6/10
Barebones plot, lacks punchy moments.
Gameplay: 8/10
Satisfying loop, fun gunplay, though a bit repetitive.
Depth: 5/10
High potential, not enough fleshed-out content.
Replayability: 7/10
Not a ton of variety, but easy to pick up again later.
Mechanics: 6/10
Feels smooth overall, some rough edges.
Fun: 8/10
Consistently entertaining despite its flaws.
Final Word
It’s safe to say Ghost Recon Wildlands isn’t a technical marvel or a boundary-pushing epic. But if you’re after an easygoing shooter with a massive sandbox to explore, it still has its appeal. Sometimes, simple can be good – and Wildlands manages to prove that point nicely, even if you’re left wishing for a little more depth and polish.

Overall: 7/10
but a GOOD 7/10 that you won't regret.

185564759.review:
Tom Clancy's Ghost Recon Wildlands has garnered significant acclaim since its release, marking a notable entry in the realm of tactical shooters. Set against the backdrop of Bolivia, the game offers an expansive open world that encourages exploration and strategic gameplay. The attention to detail in the environment is remarkable; players can traverse diverse terrains ranging from lush jungles to arid deserts, all while engaging in missions that emphasize teamwork and tactical planning.

The game's multiplayer functionality serves as a pivotal aspect contributing to its positive reception. Players can collaborate with friends or engage with others online, fostering a sense of camaraderie that enhances the overall experience. The option to approach missions either stealthily or with brute force allows for personalized gameplay styles, catering to both casual gamers and those seeking a more immersive military simulation. This flexibility enables players to experiment with various tactics, which ultimately promotes replayability.

Furthermore, Ghost Recon Wildlands features an engaging narrative centered around combating drug cartels in a fictionalized version of Bolivia. The storyline not only provides context for player actions but also addresses relevant social issues related to drug trafficking and its effects on society. This thematic depth adds layers to the gameplay experience, inviting players to reflect on the moral implications inherent within their virtual missions.

In conclusion, Tom Clancy's Ghost Recon Wildlands succeeds as both an entertaining video game and a thought-provoking commentary on contemporary issues. Its combination of expansive environments, cooperative gameplay mechanics, and meaningful narrative elements solidifies its status as a standout title within the genre.

185543957.review:
I've played this for around 250 hours on Ubisoft Connect/Uplay.
I can say without a doubt that this is one of my favourite games.

I love the open world and the environment, I love the music, I love the (somewhat simplified) tacti-coolness, I love the sandboxyness, I love the illusion of freedom, I love the difficulty tweaking, I love the coop, I love the hidden stuff, I love the immersion, I love all the fun it gave me. Surprisingly enough, even though I'm not the typical stealth enjoyer, this is one of the few games in which stealth feels fun for me (I guess it's due to the immersion in general).

I don't like the braindead/aimbot AI, but, hey, you have unlimited amounts of 100% FOV thermal vision and unrealistically quiet "suppressed" 9x19, or 5.56x45, or even .50 BMG, lol.
I don't really care about the "story" (it's got some CIA drama or something, lol, very tomclancey).
One thing I really hate — this was *the* game that gave me the most immersive fight against el diablo cazador de hombres (yes, the Predator)! While I eventually learned his behaviours and was able to best him with a Beretta 92 only, it still gave me the best feeling of almost being in the movie. Why do I hate this great thing, you may ask? Because the mission "The Jungle Moved" got removed from the game. :( https://ghostrecon.fandom.com/wiki/The_Jungle_Moved 
Another thing I hate is that this is another "live service" game for which we have no servers other than the official Ubisoft ones (which will eventually be shut down). It's such a shame that one of the best coop experiences will be buried deep at the software graveyard.

Also, if you don't like trial & error to find out the OP weapons for yourself, read this: 
https://github.com/subvod/examples/blob/master/misc/TCGRW.MD#the-best-loadout

I've played dailies & weeklies so much, that I've managed to unlock all the weapons. There's even a musket (it's very underpowered), a Colt Single Action Army, and some other old (and some weird) weapons, you can cosplay/roleplay as almost anything (there isn't a Mosin-Nagant rifle though, there's mostly American oldies).
You can challenge yourself to anything (e.g. Ghost mode with unsupressed pistol only) and this is another big charming thing of the game.

1o/1o, thank you very much, Ubisoft, I sincerely hope you don't get burnt down to the ground by bigger capitalists than you!

185538340.review:
Tom Clancy's Ghost Recon Wildlands, казалось, обещал стать захватывающим тактическим шутером с открытым миром, но, к сожалению, игра не оправдала ожиданий. Несмотря на обширные карты и возможность исследования, Wildlands страдает от множества недостатков, которые делают игровой процесс утомительным и однообразным.
Во-первых, сюжет игры оказался плоским и абсолютно неинтересным. История о борьбе с наркокартелем в Боливии не предлагает ничего нового и интересного. Персонажи выглядят шаблонно и не вызывают симпатии, что делает прохождение сюжета скучным. Миссии часто повторяются, и к середине игры становится ясно, что разработчики не потрудились создать разнообразие в заданиях. ОДНИМ СЛОВОМ США НЕСУТ РАДУЖНУЮ ДЕМОКРАТИЮ В СТРАНЫ 3его МИРА. БОЖЕ, ХРАНИ АМЕРИКУ
Графика, хотя и выглядит неплохо на первый взгляд, страдает от недостатка детализации и не всегда стабильной производительности. Иногда игра демонстрирует заметные артефакты, что отвлекает от общего впечатления. Кроме того, ИИ противников оставляет желать лучшего — они действуют предсказуемо и часто не представляют никакой угрозы, что делает бои легкими и неинтересными. Касаемо, сложностей просто процентное повышение урона.
Мультиплеерный режим, который должен был стать изюминкой, тоже не оправдал ожиданий. В коопе часто сталкивались с проблемами соединения, а балансировка повстанцев вызывает вопросы. Особенно разочаровывают баги, которые время от времени возникают в игре, портя опыт совместного прохождения.
В итоге, Tom Clancy's Ghost Recon Wildlands оказался разочарованием для многих фанатов серии. Несмотря на некоторые интересные идеи и потенциал, игра не смогла их реализовать, оставив игроков с ощущением бессмысленности и скуки. Если вы ищете захватывающий тактический шутер, лучше обратить внимание на другие проекты.

185463569.review:
In Bolivia’s vast and sunlit land,
The Ghosts unite, a lethal band.
Cartel lords rule with iron grip,
But stealth and skill will sink their ship.

From jungle depths to mountain steep,
Through deserts dry where shadows creep,
You choose the path, both bold and sly,
Attack by day or in the night sky.

The world’s alive, a stunning sprawl,
With danger lurking in its thrall.
Convoys roll and rebels rise,
A playground vast beneath wide skies.

Yet flaws appear through careful gaze,
Repetitive the Ghosts' displays.
Some missions feel a touch too bare,
And polish fades in open air.

But story shines in single play,
Even squad of friends can save the day.
Each plan unfolds, a whispered call,
One wrong step might ruin it all.

So get your gear, the hunt’s begun,
In Wildlands' world of grit and gun.
Though not without a fault or two,
Its tactical charm still rings true.

185264056.review:
In Ghost Recon Wildlands, I didn’t just play; I breathed in the crisp mountain air, felt the crunch of gravel under my boots, and carried the weight of decisions that blurred the line between hero and invader. Each mission wasn’t just a checkpoint; it was a story, a thread in a tapestry of rebellion and redemption, woven with bullets and whispered promises of freedom.

   The Santa Blanca cartel was more than an enemy. It was a shadow that loomed over every village, every roadblock, every whispered conversation around a campfire. I didn’t just fight them—I unraveled their empire, piece by bloody piece. My squad and I, a band of ghosts, were the storm that swept through their strongholds. Sometimes, it was a quiet takedown under a moonlit sky; other times, it was chaos, the air thick with smoke and the roar of gunfire. Every encounter left its mark, on both the enemy and me.

   But Wildlands wasn’t just about the fight; it was about the silence in between. Cruising through the countryside as the sun set, the sky ablaze with color, I felt the world breathe around me. Moments of peace were rare but profound—a reminder of what we fought to preserve. This wasn’t just a game. It was a journey, a relentless push against the odds, where every victory was earned, and every loss lingered long after the controller was set down.

185217368.review:
Excellent 3rd person tactical shooter. The sandbox world is beautiful and varied, probably the best Ubisoft title of the decade.

+ Long-range sniping with satisfying bullet drop 
+ More than 50 guns to customize and even more uniques
+ Explosions go crazy
+ Parachutes 
+ Beautiful open world, actually varied parts of the map (mountainous, jungle, lakes, rivers, desert, tundra)
+ Day night cycle with pretty sunrises and sunsets (how do not all games have this yet)
+ No tether in co-op, you can be 10+ km apart doing separate objectives
+ Seamless join-in-progress story progress is saved individually and XP for repeating missions
+ Stealth executions, suppressors galore
+ Vehicle variety and detail (APCs, Helicopters, Planes, Trains, Automobiles, Motorcycles, boats, lambo, etc).


- Some typical Ubisoft co-op join bugs (restarting game a few times can fix it)



Very fun in co-op. The closest thing we have to MGS:V cooperative gameplay.

Your frustration is valid and I'd like to provide some assistance by way of troubleshooting that should help remedy what you're experiencing. 

- Start out with our [url=https://www.ubisoft.com/en-gb/help/connectivity-and-performance/article/troubleshooting-technical-issues-on-pc/000061047]basic PC troubleshooting article[/url] to cross off the most common performance issue causes

- Ensure that your PC is [url=https://www.ubisoft.com/en-us/help/connectivity-and-performance/article/switching-to-your-pcs-dedicated-gpu/000081045]utilizing your dedicated GPU[/url] over any other GPUs present (i.e. an integrated one)
- Disable any overclocking that you may have enabled in your PC

If the freezing issues keep occurring, please consider [url=https://support.ubisoft.com/en-US/Cases/New?method=Chat&platform=29&game=50003&category=219&hideFields=all&af=1&source=help]creating a case[/url] on our Help Site and submit your system files ([url=https://www.ubisoft.com/en-us/help/connectivity-and-performance/article/generating-a-microsoft-system-information-report/000078753]MSInfo[/url] & [url=https://www.ubisoft.com/en-us/help/connectivity-and-performance/article/generating-a-directx-diagnostic-report/000078583]Dxdiag[/url]) so that the team can look deeper into this issue. 185019193.review:
Tom Clancy’s Ghost Recon is a thrilling tactical shooter that perfectly blends strategy, teamwork, and immersive open-world gameplay. Whether you’re tackling missions solo or teaming up with friends, the game offers an incredible sense of freedom and excitement as you plan and execute your operations.

The open world is massive and beautifully designed, filled with diverse environments ranging from dense jungles and rugged mountains to bustling villages and military compounds. Each mission feels like a sandbox, giving you the freedom to choose how to approach your objectives—stealthily or with guns blazing. The tactical elements, like syncing shots with your squad or customizing your loadout, add depth and reward thoughtful planning.

One of the game’s standout features is the variety of gear and weapons available, allowing you to tailor your character to suit your playstyle. The co-op experience is exceptional, encouraging communication and teamwork, which makes even the toughest missions a blast. Playing with friends elevates the fun to a whole new level as you coordinate strategies and pull off cinematic moments together.

The game is further enhanced by regular updates and events, which keep the content fresh and engaging. The AI poses a decent challenge, and the story missions are complemented by a plethora of side activities that add hours of replayability. For fans of tactical shooters, the attention to detail and the emphasis on realism are sure to impress.

In conclusion, Tom Clancy’s Ghost Recon is a must-play for anyone who loves open-world exploration, tactical gameplay, and thrilling action. Whether you’re a lone wolf or part of a squad, this game delivers an unforgettable experience. Highly recommended!

184822987.review:
The narrative of the game is your run-of-the-mill secret CIA OP to take down a drug kingpin of a cartel somewhere in Bolivia. The map is huge, the cartel network is large and thus you get the feeling that you will have your hands full with tons of things to do. 

But, that is until you start taking down one or two bosses. After that, you spot the repetitive nature of the missions you get assigned, the dull and predictable conversations between you and your boss-lady Bowman sitting hidden behind her desk and commanding you to do this and that. There is a shit load of side-missions you can do to strengthen the rebel NPCs aiding you and to improve your weapon arsenal. That being said, you will most probably find yourself using the same 2 weapons (an AR and a Sniper rifle) with silencers and trying to get shit done as quick as possible flying in a helicopter (since driving is really a poor experience). The stealth mechanics of this game are also...dull. Nothing special there. Overall, the game gets pretty repetitive as per usual with UBISOFT titles.

That being said, I finished the whole game, dismantled 100% of the cartel and there is a relatively nice story to be said by the game, which is what kept me and the reason of the positive review. However, that being translated to a score would be something like 5/10 or 6/10 max.

Another thing, is that I played the game solo. Most probably you will have a better experience in a multi-player concept but only if you bring your own party. And that's because I tried matchmaking many times, yet I never managed to find a group to play with in any mission.

184809089.review:
Far From Perfect, But Impossible to Put Down

If “action-packed sandbox shooter with a hint of Far Cry DNA” makes your ears perk up, Ghost Recon Wildlands might just be your cup of tea. It doesn't aim to be a masterpiece, but it’s got a certain charm that might keep you hooked for hours on end. Here’s my take:

First Impressions
From the get-go, Wildlands can feel like a “dumbed down Far Cry,” loaded with explosions and frenetic encounters. Unfortunately, the plot itself doesn’t match the bombast of the action: there’s a noticeable shortage of cutscenes, and the sub-villains never really get fleshed out. The main antagonist stands out, but everyone else seems to blur together, making each major moment feel fleeting and a bit shallow.

Characters & Dialogue
Your squad might look ready for anything, but their collective personality doesn’t go much further than a handful of voice lines – repeated ad nauseam. Lacking backstories also strip them of depth, which is a real shame, as some more character development and banter could’ve made the story much more immersive.

Gameplay Loop
The core gameplay loop remains undeniably satisfying. Even if there aren’t a ton of mission types, the gunplay feels smooth, and stealth takedowns are fun enough to keep you invested. Unfortunately, from the start, you have access to one of the most versatile weapons in the game, so there’s little reason to experiment with the vast armory. A greater incentive to use and master new weapons would’ve given the game more longevity.

Tier One Mode
Tier One mode is an intriguing concept but jumps in difficulty drastically – you go from story mode to an unforgiving extreme difficulty way too early. Reaching rank 20 is already tough, and beyond that, it feels like you’re just getting knocked out faster without a nuanced increase in difficulty. More stats, more balancing, and a gentler yet still challenging curve would’ve gone a long way here.

Where It Shines
Despite the weak narrative and shallow squadmates, there’s something inherently “comfortable” about playing Wildlands. The setting, the gunplay, and the open-world exploration all blend into a reliable experience that players seem to return to, even if it’s not revolutionary. It’s an excellent title to fire up for a few missions, blow off some steam, and then come back to whenever you’re craving more.

Where It Could Improve
Imagine if it had an extra year of development:

Radio Variety & Interactivity: More channels, more chatter, more life in the world.
Deeper Stats & Visuals: Detailed breakdowns of weapons, vehicles, and regions.
Interconnected Story: Stronger links between sub-villains, with real consequences for your actions in each region.
Dynamic Control: A power tug-of-war among the cartel, Unidad, and rebels.
Enhanced Enemy Dialogue: More situational lines, especially when sneaking around.
Vehicle Challenges & Collectibles: Logging each variant in a collection, stats included, plus improved summoning so vehicles don’t spawn 400 meters away.
Scores
Story: 5.5/10
Barebones plot, lacks punchy moments.
Gameplay: 8/10
Satisfying loop, fun gunplay, though a bit repetitive.
Depth: 5/10
High potential, not enough fleshed-out content.
Replayability: 7/10
Not a ton of variety, but easy to pick up again later.
Mechanics: 6.5/10
Feels smooth overall, some rough edges.
Fun: 8/10
Consistently entertaining despite its flaws.
Final Word
It’s safe to say Ghost Recon Wildlands isn’t a technical marvel or a boundary-pushing epic. But if you’re after an easygoing shooter with a massive sandbox to explore, it still has its appeal. Sometimes, simple can be good – and Wildlands manages to prove that point nicely, even if you’re left wishing for a little more depth and polish.

Overall: 7/10 
but a GOOD 7/10 that you won't regret.

184595834.review:
Este juego es realmente divertido. Si te dan miedo o curiosidad el género estratégico este juego es uno muy bueno para empezar y más adelante jugar otros más serios y complejos.

El juego en sí esta muy bueno en general, tiene algún que otro bug pero no son taan recurrentes ni graves. Hay misiones en el que trabajas codo a codo con otros personajes del universo Tom Clancy's y para un fan de esto como yo, es genial. No daré spoilers.

Una de mis quejas podría ser que son tímidos al entregarte armas nuevas, por ejemplo, para tener la iconica AK-47 debes completar una ciudad de 5 ESTRELLAS ¿Por qué no nos la dan al principio o en una más fácil? es una AK, no una super arma moderna no tiene sentido. Además que estaría mejor si la usas en los entornos mas precarios ya que queda bien, pero no. Desbloqueas el arma más normal en las misiones más díficiles.

Otra queja son las lootboxes, no es tan grave ni necesario, pero teniendo en cuenta el tiempo que ha pasado ya del juego y como actualmente está algo muerto, estaría bueno que puedas conseguir las cajas mediante el gameplay o poder elegir el objeto que querés y comprarlo.

Por último una queja personal: Hay mucha ausencia de música, más que nada la radio. Apenas hay canciones y, lo peor, la radio está en un volumen muy bajo. Parece tontera pero se puede perder la inmersión. Latinoamerica es muy musiquera y el hecho de apenas escuchar cumbias, bachatas, reguetón, o música folklorica/tradicional del país ya te hace sentir que más bien estás en un juego y no en Bolivia

Pero el juego es muy épico y divertidísimo en cooperativo, podés ayudar a amigos, amigos ayudarte a vos, o los dos pasarse el juego juntos y es muy bueno. Otra cosa positiva de jugar online es que si tu compañero se le va al inter o a ti el juego no hace mucho espamento por este suceso. Simplemente tu escuadra manejada por bots reaparece al rescate y, si se quieren volver a conectar, no se hace un problema como otros juegos que si se te va la internet debes salir y volver a entrar al juego. Solo te unes de nuevo y listo.


Un juego con mucho contenido ya de por sí y he visto que tienen DLC's, independientemente de si sean buenos o malos hay contenido y punto. Eso es bastante considerando que capaz me gasté un poco menos de 10 dolares en este juego

La verdad 10/10

184534088.review:
Positives:
-Realistically vast open world
-Many ways to approach each mission (most of the times)
-Impressive damage model
-Is quite close to feeling realistic
-Unlockables add an extra layer of replayability for discovering the entire story
-Does not try to look futuristic to the point of becoming unrealistic
-Co-op is fun and if the members know how to act tactical it can offer another layer of interaction

Negatives:
-Vehicles overreact to commands (at least on keyboard), over accelerating or immediately reversing when pressing the S button
-The only instance in which you can be equiped with realistic equipment (1 main weapon & 1 sidearm only) is if you play on Ghost Mode and you are not able to unequip everything in case you want to scout inside cities or villages, meaning that you look suspicious to people (friendly NPC's will not react to you being equiped with weapons if holstered, however it can't be helped but feel unnatural for an operative to walk around the streets giving away their identity if someone wants to add a roleplaying element and do some actual scouting or gathering collectibles before tackling the main objectives)
-Your team can't stay very far behind or take orders such as scouting for you or disable certain items such as siren alarms and generators. This itself is not a big deal but A) if you want to have a member disable something that is far away from you while you attack a target that you are close to, the teammates won't be able to help you with that, meaning you have to do this yourself and B) If you try to leave your squad behind in a RZ and go scout for intel in a base before going back or telling them to get close so that you can work on a strategy, they'll teleport close to you. This is useful in order not to have your members stuck far away when you need them but I felt like I wanted to apoint certain orders to specific squad members at times
-While I guess the programming wouldn't be possible for such thing, It sometimes feels unrealistic when ghosts are running around the map and people see them during missions, even getting scared by the weapons if the player hasn't holstered them. It would be cool if we could see squads working like real squads with players (leaders) ordering the members to slowly cross a road with 1 member staying on the lookout while the other one would cross and then the other 2 members would follow before the one on the lookout would follow the rest. Of course this would require too much programming so I don't complain with what we got eventually. It's just that when I tried to play the game without driving or using fast travel (and it happened quite early as I was interested into actually playing tactical), it felt more as if the Ghosts were sent on a training drill and people knew they were there to exercise rather than being in a stealthy mission avoiding contact at all cost. The only instance this didn't feel that way was when I would order the squad to go guns blazing in city locations where the rebels and the Ghosts would eventually get into an actual warzone where things would truly shine and see quite realistic and intense
-While the inclusion of 2 different enemy factions is quite interesting and has a great dynamic as you can let them fight eachother while you make your escape, sometimes it's truly unnatural and even irritating to be spotted while driving even from the very moment you step foot on Bolivia, when they would possibly not have put a bounty on the Ghosts yet. What helps in making this seem plausible is that the characters always hold or at least have guns in their holsters, but this is where acting like a real operative fails
-I wasn't able to disable bagpacks and there are some missions in which it doesn't make sense for an operative to bring any bagpack with them at all as it would possibly add extra weight (mostly the stealthy missions)
-I noticed it was fixed in the sequel, but it's a good thing to mention this as a negative for this one and a positive for the next game: When changing the time of day, the instance resets. I suspect this is done in order to preserve resources in terms of graphics but by reseting, it means that all the scouting is lost. In the sequel there are RZ's (Bivouacs) close to key mission locations (not safehouses) so it's easy to just change the time and then proceed with the mission nearby as would happen in real conditions. The only way I could scout first and then wait till it was the right time to attack was by hiding in prone close to the mission area and staying idle. The inclusion of both safehouses and RZ's would be great for the 3rd instalment except if the story puts players in an extremely hostile situation as with Breakpoint

Overall, Wildlands is an extremely enjoyable experience that I would more than 100% recommend to any non - linear tactical / stealth shooter enthusiast or even open world fans! It requires skill and reflexes and has an interesting story that feels down to earth and intense at the same time (I'm not talking about the Narco Road DLC by the way, which while it includes one of my favorite antagonists feels unrealistic at the same time). If you have time to explore and truly immerse yourselves in such experience go buy this game and get the complete edition! You will love every second spent in the game and you will notice that each time you will be trying to outdo yourself by actually getting better not at playing but at acting smart in that environment in order to achieve your objectives! I was unable to play it when it came out due to my computer not strong enough to handle most of the games of that time, but I am truly grateful that I decided to buy both the standalone edition that was on Steam Sales about 4 - 5 months ago and the complete edition about a month ago for both Wildlands and Breakpoint

184346953.review:
Ghost Recon Wildland ist als taktisches Spiel beschrieben, mit Open-World-Mappe und schon bekannt für die Reihe.

Der/Die Spieler/in spielt als Boss von einer militärischen Spezialeinheit, mit 4 "Ghosts" mitglieder und man wird in Südamerika für eine Mission geschickt. Diese Mission findet sich in Bolivien statt und die ist das Drogenkartell [i]Santa Blanca[/i] zerstören, dabei der Oberhaupt des Kartells [i]El Sueño[/i] töten. Die Geschichte ist wirklich Progressiv und gut detailliert, aber der Fokus ist als [b]Ghost[/b] spielen, d.h. wo keiner von Gegner etwas weißt oder hat etwas gesehen. Jedoch allgemein hat Freiheit wie der Spieler spielt.

Das Spiel ist Modern Umwelt und hat auch eine gute Menge von Waffen, Gegenstände und sowie Missionen, die die auf verschiedene Arten gemeistert werden können, vom Scharfschützen bis direkt Angriff ohne Sorge, aber das ist auf Spieler zu überlegen. Die Karte und Umgebung sind echt sehr schön, mit verschiedene Orte und man wird mit Schnee, Wald, Sumpf, Wüste usw. spielen. Die Schwierigkeit ist auch wirklich gut und bringt auch Realismus für das Spiel. 
Noch ein Vorteil, das Spiel hat die Möglichkeit online, wo man bis 4 Spieler zusammen spielen kann, oder Freundschaft. 
Auch eine Empfehlung ist die DLCs, wo es mehr Missionen dabei gebracht wurde. DLC Fallen Ghost ist wunderbar, leider sind die DLCs nicht im Hauptspiel geflossen, sondern als extra und die sind separat zu spielen.
Info: Der Charakter kann jederzeit angepasst werden.

Ich konnte die Zeit im Spiel wirklich genießen und Spaß haben, ohne langweilig zu sein. Die Errungenschaften sind nicht zu schwer zu bekommen und die sind auch bei Steam verfügbar. Da muss ich auf jeden Fall das Spiel weiter empfehlen und eine Bemerkung, wenn man mit Freunden spielt, macht echt riesiges Spaß. 

Was ich als negativ schreiben muss, ist KI von den anderen Unterstützer (3 Ghost) nicht ganz gut und die helfen nicht wirklich, sogar stören. Die Kontrolle vom Flugzeug ist eigentlich nicht gut, sowie manche Reaktionen von anderen Verkehrsmittel. Es hat mir auch nicht gefallen, wenn ich als Verdächtig war und ich habe auch die Position gewechselt, in viele Fälle die Gegner wussten, ganz genau wo ich war.

Empfehlenswert! Schau mal das Spiel im Angebot zu kaufen und man kann auch das komplett kaufen, für einen niedrige Preis.

184253961.review: So, while I do recommend this game to some, Wildlands really lives up to its name by having some wild bugs and glitches, and teammate AI is some of the worst I've seen, even by 2017 standards. This type of tactical gameplay needs very competent AI to cover your back, lay down suppressing fire, as well as revive you in a timely fashion; they do not do any of these things most of the time. For example, your AI teammates will watch you eat lead, do nothing, and then will take 30 seconds to revive you because they crouched there looking at you. Furthermore, the driving is god-awful. Now, sometimes it can be entertaining. I played this originally on the PS4, a while after it released, and watched my bike, after going off a hill, fly damn near all the way across the map until I crashed landed and died. However, outside of these rare funny moments, it is often times to janky and slippery; when driving vehicles, or touchy; when flying planes, to sluggish; when operating a helicopter. Whats worse, however, is the story. It is so damn generic and boring, I typically just skip whatever cutscene I come across. Granted, the moment to moment gameplay, when it works, is an absolute blast. There is a great selection of weapons for many weapon types. Most have customization, with a few that cannot be customized for being special weapons. However, much of the map is quite barren, limiting the settings in which gunfights happen and thus not allowing a lot of them to shine. Overall, WIldlands has many problems that cannot be overlooked, but when the gunplay and tactical options come together, TCGR: W's is a fun time, and most likely better played with friends. Thus, I would give it a 7/10, but is something I recommend to get on-sale.

183788114.review:
Ghost Recon Wildlands is an Open World shooter that can be played in Single- and Multiplayer in an campain and in competitive PvP modes.
I played solely the campain and I have to say, its incredibly generic, boring, buggy and generally not fun. In typical Ubisoft-manner the idea of the creators was to create a game that stretches as long as possible with almost interesting topics, yet putting in the lowest ammount of effort possible.
You play as an US-Army special squadleader, who is trying to dismantle a drug-cartel in Bolivia by dismantling 4 "big" sections of it, to eventually get to the boss. You do that in various ways, fulfilling missions to annoy little "bosses" till they show themselves so you can either kill or kidnap them. if that sounds like committing multiple acts of warcrimes, that is because it is, which is the most funny part about all of this.
The US has a reason to overthrow the corrupt Bolivian government, but this reason is so incredibly unimportant, that you can solely see it in one of the three trailers that play when you are idle in the main menu, as well as at the very end where it is shortly noted.
So it mainly focusses on overthrowing the corrupt drug-empire that builds the government and help rebells to regain power.
As it is open world you are free to explore everything in the order you want, but it is completely unnecessary and just complicates stuff - instead its likely you clear the area of one miniboss just to travel to the next and do pretty much the same things again.
For the main story that is "travel to place a and kill someone", "travel to place a and sneak to gather intel", "follow person without being seen", "take person hostage and kidnap it", "defend position", "tavel to place a and destroy object". While this can sound alright and typical for such kind of game, you pretty much repeat about 5 of these missions for any of these minibosses, which are 19(!) +4 minibossses with about one of these missions, +4 with about two of these missions till you can get the full ending of the last boss where you do up to two of these missions.
In other words, things get repetitive incredibly fast.
Especially when it comes to rebel-missions, which are seperate and exist to increase reputation among rebels, to level up certain support skills. these consist of 5 different missions that you gotta do about 5 ot 6 different times per area, so up to 21 (if i remember correctly). and then there are also "steal plane/helicopter" missions, abour 2-3 per location, that also all play the same (and only help you gaining a recource to level). So not only do you do the exact same things in the main missions, you also play the exact same things in the side missions. over and over and over again - stretched to the extreme. if you played one of the "steal plane/helicopter" missions for example (works for all the other types too) you pretty much played them all, yet of course are forced to play them over and over and over again. (including another "sidemission" which is stopping a convoy to gain their ressources, but they dont count towards any progression, so i dont count them) And if that wasnt enough, they themselve can stretch a lot as well. Escpecially the helicopter/plane stealing. sometimes forcing you to travel for minutes to complete the mission, in which you do nothing but press forward. straight forward. and if you fail the landing (which with the small runways for planes or sometimes the anti aircraft units that can hardly be dodged or disabled can sometimes happen) you can do the same thing again. cause repetition without any challange is so fun.
Also shoutout to the hundrets of collectibles scathered around the map without any reasoning. that sure was something missing in this game


All of the NPCs feel like cardboard cutouts that would be titled "placeholder for when we can think of something better". And sadly, with the way the game hypes them up, they are the most interesting part of the game, even when there isnt really a payoff for anything.
Rebels say nothing, maybe one line when you pass them per area
enemies repeat the... about 3 same lines every time you encounter them
civilians say nothing
the squad says the same 2 or 3 lines for repeating a similar mission (but with the twist of it being... in another location... but again... whoooooohooo, spooky)
With the minibosses you speak about once and after finishing them, you can forget about them - even when the game hypes every one of them up about being "a key figure in the functionality of the cartel", while after defeating them pretty much nothing changes about the strength or the unfeelable power of the cartel.
Even the endboss feels super empty. the game tells you, almost screams at you "hey, you gotta see this guy as the evil person", yet you encounter him so rarely that the traits the game hypes him up as, are invicible to the player.
And your contractor, while having personality, shifts it at will, especially when in one area of the map she is supposed to be kidnapped and on the other you are supposed to meet her. While her moodswings and teleportation through location she also acts incredibly stupid. threatens enemies where no threatening is needed or tells them things that on one hand nobody is supposed to know (as per story "we are there on secret mission, nobody can know we even exist etc.) or that are against our own interest. Her moodswings get so bad that at the end of the game, the two endings differ in nothing - everything playing out exactly the same - yet she just having a line removed in the other ending. its hiddeous, its bland, its boring, its generic.

At the end there is the lags and difficultytweak, although the difficultytweak is purely summarized with "make enemies bulletsponges, increase their damage, increase their aim, so that the player can only hide and let the rest of the broken ai squad do the heavy work."
Im talking about broken AI, as it is bound to run off and get themselves killed afar from cover to pick them up again or the ai simply doing nothing, while you lay on the ground and wait for them to pick you up, causing you to lay on the ground and do nothing(!) for a whole minute (cause you only sometimes get the "reset on last checkpoint" option).
sometimes it happens that drones, something very important for the late game, just arent accessable if you use them or guns and scopes being invisible. killed me more than once, and was frustrating and unfun every time.
Although another fun mechanic that was added in relation to difficulty is a unit called "Unidad", which is like a policeforce that shoots you unprovoked and randomly roams the streets. meaning that when you restart a mission and spawn it can happen, that you spawn next to a patroll, that either guns you down or calls for backup, that you either have to run from, making missionprogression annoying as heck, or just let them kill you so you can restart, losing you several minutes of your life.

And I think thats a pretty good summary of this game. its a waste of time. it drags, it is not fun, it is buggy, it is uninteresting, it is repetitive, it is agonizing, and deserves a solid 
2/10 for gameplayfun (as stealthing can be fun sometimes and the bombdrone is funny, even though incredibly overpowered)
0/10 for story
9/10 for graphics
7/10 for functionality
6/10 for controlls (driving cars is driving a brick on wheels, riding bikes is gambling between a buggy crash and getting flung everywhere, helicopters are main transportation method that break easily but function well enough and planes are just awful in powering and landing)
0/10 for variety (like fun with sidemissions, (here non-existing) minigames, collectibles)
0/10 for replayability 
0/10 for challange (/fun with the provided challange, as overpowered enemies are hard but not fun)
1/10 for details (like personality for characters or places)
0/10 for the price (would give negative numbers due to microtransactions)

虽然是罐头，但是味道很不错。
吐槽一下三个AI队友，一人有难，三人围观。
游戏风景非常棒，场景设计是顶级的，这方面育碧的工业实力没的说。
剧情方面：前期有点寡淡，后期几个小头目、BOSS、反抗军头目、阵亡特工的故事等等，非常有代入感。
枪械手感都不错，可以自定义配件，可玩性很强。
载具手感很好，尤其是直升飞机超级好开，在游戏里甚至可以玩极品飞机、极品摩托、极品装甲车。
游戏优化特别好，这么大的无缝地图还很流畅，画面放到现在也不过时。
美中不足就是视角太少，尤其是载具视角只有第三人称，有点遗憾。
单人极限难度有点坐牢，但是多人太卡了，体验不佳。
PS：育碧要是多一些这样的优质作品，何至于落到今天这样的窘境。

183711478.review:
[i]“Команда духів виходить на полювання – Болівія ще не знала такої війни!”[/i]

[b]Рецензія на Ghost Recon: Wildlands[/b]

[b]Графіка:[/b]

Ghost Recon: Wildlands захоплює реалістичністю відображення природи Болівії. Гори, джунглі, соляні рівнини та пустелі виглядають неймовірно деталізованими, створюючи враження, ніби ви справді перебуваєте в цьому світі. Час доби та погодні ефекти додають атмосфери, змінюючи вигляд локацій залежно від умов. Однак персонажі, особливо NPC, виглядають менш вражаюче, а іноді можна побачити візуальні баги, такі як текстури, які запізнюються з завантаженням.

[b]Геймплей:[/b]

Геймплей Wildlands зосереджений на відкритому світі, повному завдань, які можна виконувати будь-яким способом. Гравець може вибирати між стелсом, відкритим боєм або тактичною роботою з командою. Такі свободи дій надають задоволення, але після кількох годин гри стає помітно, що багато місій повторюють одні й ті ж шаблони: атакувати базу, викрасти інформацію або ліквідувати ціль.

Система управління транспортом заслуговує окремої згадки, адже водіння машин і польоти гелікоптерів іноді здаються занадто аркадними та нелогічними. Також можна зіткнутися з дещо «штучним» поведінкою ворогів, які не завжди адекватно реагують на дії гравця.

Гра блищить у кооперативному режимі, де чотири гравці можуть координувати свої дії. Це справді найкращий спосіб насолодитися Wildlands, адже штучний інтелект ваших напарників у соло-режимі часто залишає бажати кращого.

[b]Сюжет:[/b]

Сюжет Ghost Recon: Wildlands простий і прямо лінійний: команда спецпризначенців бореться проти наркокартелю «Санта-Бланка». Історія подається через серію завдань, кожне з яких присвячено окремим лідерам картелю. Хоча сюжетна структура добре служить для побудови загального прогресу, персонажі виглядають поверхневими. Самі антагоністи, хоча й мають цікаві ідеї, не отримують достатнього екранного часу, щоб розкритися повністю.

[b]Музика:[/b]

Музика в Wildlands підкреслює атмосферу Болівії завдяки етнічним мотивам і драматичним трекам під час бойових ситуацій. Однак вона не завжди запам’ятовується і скоріше виконує функцію фону, ніж стає важливим елементом гри. Радіо в автомобілях додає трохи настрою, але могло б мати більше різноманітності.

[b]Недоліки:[/b]

Повторюваність завдань і шаблонність місій.

Штучний інтелект союзників і ворогів.

Проблеми з фізикою транспорту та керуванням.

Сюжет, який не вражає глибиною чи розвитком персонажів.


[b]Оцінка:[/b]

Ghost Recon: Wildlands отримує 7/10. Це гра, яка сяє у кооперативному режимі, пропонуючи великий відкритий світ і свободу вибору. Однак повторюваність, слабкий сюжет і технічні недоліки не дозволяють їй стати шедевром.

[b]Підсумок:[/b]

Wildlands – це весела ігрова пісочниця для тих, хто любить відкриті світи та тактичний підхід до місій. Проте якщо ви шукаєте глибокий сюжет або різноманітний геймплей, гра може розчарувати. Грайте з друзями – це значно покращить ваш досвід!

183676894.review:
Minha Analise Sobre Tom Clancy’s Ghost Recon® Wildlands:
Tom Clancy's Ghost Recon: Wildlands é um jogo de tiro em primeira pessoa desenvolvido pela Ubisoft e lançado em 2017. O jogo se passa em um mundo aberto vasto e perigoso, ambientado na Bolívia, onde um cartel de drogas chamado Santa Blanca tomou o controle do país1.

Aqui estão alguns pontos principais sobre o jogo:

Jogabilidade
Mundo Aberto: Os jogadores podem explorar a vasta paisagem da Bolívia, incluindo montanhas, desertos e florestas.

Cooperativo: O jogo é projetado para ser jogado com até três amigos em cooperação online, mas também pode ser jogado sozinho com companheiros controlados por IA.

Personalização: Os jogadores podem criar e personalizar seus próprios personagens, escolhendo armas, equipamentos e táticas.

História
A história segue um esquadrão de elite das Forças Especiais dos EUA conhecido como "Ghosts", que são enviados para derrubar o cartel Santa Blanca e restaurar a ordem no país.

Modos de Jogo
História Principal: A campanha principal envolve missões para desmantelar a infraestrutura do cartel.

Ghost War: Um modo PvP (jogador contra jogador) onde equipes de quatro jogadores se enfrentam em batalhas táticas.

Requisitos
O jogo está disponível para Xbox One, PlayStation 4 e PC. Ele oferece uma experiência imersiva com gráficos impressionantes e uma jogabilidade envolvente.

183618647.review:
The game strongly reminds FarCry 5 which is not bad. The game was made by the same team and doesn't seem strange in this case

Graphics is extremely beautiful and customizable. A decent, big map, world, and environment. Almost everything is customizable except, maybe, vehicles.

It took the most perfect parts from "Future Soldier" and added several totally new features. If in the previous game, you could modify weapons and just follow the story completing the campaign missions one by one, this game takes everything to a new level. First of all, it's now a sandbox with an open world. The whole plot is huge which grants many campaign missions in different locations as well as side missions with their own characters and goals. It wouldn't be without many filler missions as well of course. You can ride, fly, or fast-travel across the entire map with the AI team or in co-op planning every detail you'll do in each combat.

The game is complex in its implementation with good graphics and physics, an enormous range of different weapons, with customizable things like appearance, apparel, weapons, team, etc., with evolving your character and following a decent plot. Some missions are extremely hard, some are very easy, and some may get you bored (not so much). However, the game is, without hesitation, a must-play.

183534262.review: 第一次了解这部作品，是在高一的英语课上，当时有一个同学分享了荒野的宣传片配音。对于当时的我来说，可谓是相当震撼。广袤的地图、自由的行动、丰富的装备搭配深深吸引了我。奈何当时没有电脑，直到工作后的现在，才有机会一览荒野的风采。打了一百个多小时，主线和两个DLC任务全清空，只能说感觉没有想象中的那么好，哪怕育碧的罐头作品中，本作的质量也很一般。剧情上，主角将带领一支特工小队，去玻利维亚击溃贩毒集团。大小头目的结合堪称是育碧教科书般的设置，毫无新意可言，纷繁复杂的人名根本记不清，玩家所要做的就是刷刷刷完事。角色的塑造也基本不存在，主角只是一个纯粹的工具人罢了。玩法上也毫无亮点可言，依旧是射击和驾驶两个方面。射击的手感一般，枪械的种类很多，改装内容也很丰富，但是比较强力的枪只有那么几把。驾驶的手感特别差，车辆极其飘，而且本作地图很大，还有很多崎岖的地形，直升机对地面车辆的优势太大了，能用直升机的话根本没必要用车。游戏支持一到四人联机，没有联机队友的话系统会自动安排机器人队友。不过还是建议自己一个人玩，因为当玩家倒地时，机器人扶人比真人快多了。而且游戏内其实也没什么多人内容，都是刷刷刷，没什么差别。最后不得不提本作的优化水平了，可谓是相当差劲。由于育碧好几年没有管这部作品，导致本作对近年的新设备的适配度极差，导致我试了很多方法，4080也只能跑40～50帧。总的来说，这是一部很平庸的作品，除了壮观的风景以外没有一丝亮点，甚至风景也算不上什么亮点，毕竟借助现有素材库生成大规模游戏景色确实用不了多少脑力。我个人评8分吧，除非真的很爱吃罐头，否则没必要入手。
